cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 415 miles ENE of the north-western Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn west-southwest on Tuesday, move across the north-western Bahamas Wednesday, then track westward toward the east coast of Florida – likely coming ashore somewhere between North Palm Beach and Hallandale Beach late Wednesday night before crossing the peninsula.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida east coast near or just north of Port Everglades (Hallandale Beach–North Palm Beach corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Florida from the Volusia/Brevard County Line southward to Hallandale Beach, including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hallandale Beach FL northward to Altamaha Sound GA, including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-western Bahamas, entire Florida east coast (especially southeast–central Florida), and later Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes – localized totals up to 5 inches possible
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes – 2 to 4 ft surge forecast, which can exceed 3 ft
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are likely; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out during landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground possible along the Broward County coast including Port Everglades at times of high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches widespread with isolated 5 inches, producing localized flash flooding and ponding in low-lying terminal areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large surf, dangerous rip currents, and coastal erosion that may hamper vessel berthing and channel operations.
